DataElement.preferredName: Patient Infusion Catheter Pump Delivery Volume Amount Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the amount of fluid or therapy in milliliters delivered by an infusion catheter and pump. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Infusion Catheter Pump Delivery Volume
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Date of upkeep/maintenance of an infusion catheter, an invasive flexible tube placed within a tumor location to deliver fluids or therapy. [Manually-curated]_A device that is used to deliver a precise amount of drug at a specific rate._A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time._The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another._A publication that is one of a set of several similar publications.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.:(KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.:A device that is used to deliver a precise amount of drug at a specific rate.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
(KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.
A device that is used to deliver a precise amount of drug at a specific rate.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.:A publication that is one of a set of several similar publications.

Concepts.definition: The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.
A publication that is one of a set of several similar publications.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Amount or quantity of diluent/fluid administered during an infusin.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.:Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:The total quantity or number.

Concepts.definition: Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D
